name: molly conger
tweet: here is tonight's charlottesville city council agenda. i expect there will be significant public comment during the public hearing on the removal of the lee & jackson statues   https://t.co/rTxhEHNuvL  https://t.co/LNjQ7y8HTv

name: molly conger
tweet: it's meetings all the way down  https://t.co/MU18iPE1t1

name: molly conger
tweet: dr denise bonds, the director of the blue ridge health district, is here with what the mayor says is the last scheduled COVID update

name: molly conger
tweet: great news, we have negative one new cases of COVID in charlottesville  (that is because a reported case turns out to be someone who does not live here and was reallocated to the correct locality)  https://t.co/vzVvl1cFHD

name: molly conger
tweet: lofty goals, considering the rapid slowdown in vaccination rates. we've really plateaued in the last month.  https://t.co/4kwIOfeM1s

name: molly conger
tweet: the census tracts in the city that show really low vaccination rates are areas where a lot of UVA students live - dr bonds posits this may be because these students got vaccinated at home or gave their parents' address when receiving the vaccine.

name: molly conger
tweet: the health dept has partnered with the fire department to vaccinate people who can't leave their homes. the fire department has also been checking smoke detectors while they're there. if someone you know is homebound & hasn't been able to get the vaccine, contact the health dept!  https://t.co/sFNw4UaHTL

name: molly conger
tweet: the vaccine is approved for kids 12-15 now!! the health dept vaccine clinic at the abandoned JC Penney will vaccinate people 12-17 with a parent present.  https://t.co/Y2NkOLP0bj

name: molly conger
tweet: dr bonds says the best way to reduce risk of dangerous mutations is for everyone who can get vaccinated to get vaccinated, which is why the US should do everything possible to ensure other countries have access to the vaccine.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker asks about people who did not come back for their second dose. dr bonds says the health dept is doing active outreach & calling people to help them schedule appointments for that second dose if they did not set one/show up for it.

name: molly conger
tweet: dr bonds says they anticipate approval of the vaccine for 2-11 year olds sometime this fall.  due to falling cases & rising vaccination rates, council will discontinue the monthly public briefings from the health department for now.

name: molly conger
tweet: there are 94 (!!!!) attendees on the zoom webinar, but none of them want to speak on a consent agenda item.  mayor walker asks to remove item 7 for a separate vote, which is approved unanimously. consent agenda (minus item 7) passes unanimously.  https://t.co/TIEMSCgd8S

name: molly conger
tweet: i don't understand why the mayor does this - she not-infrequently will remove an item from the consent agenda... but as the mayor, she's the one who approves the agenda in the first place. just don't put it on the consent agenda? item 7 passes 4-1, with mayor walker voting no.

name: molly conger
tweet: city manager chip boyles says there was an event at tonsler park this past sunday - the splash park is open, there was a basketball tournament, and a covid vaccination event! the splash parks around the city are open for the summer.

name: molly conger
tweet: 1 of the 2 elevators at midway manor has been repaired. boyles says city staff are continuing to explore ways of working with the owners of that property (we're running out of time to figure out what happens when the LIHTC expire

name: molly conger
tweet: now on to matters by the public. if you want to speak on the statues, wait until that public hearing. this comment portion is for matters not on the agenda. only 2 people signed up for this public comment period in advance.

name: molly conger
tweet: the first person signed up for public comment had technical difficulties. next is nancy carpenter. she says the departure of hollie lee has left the home to hope program with diminished capacity - should the program move back to being administered by human services?

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy is also concerned about the conditions at midway manor & reminds council to keep in mind that it is public money flowing into the pockets of the owners of that property.

name: molly conger
tweet: anthony artuso asks council to postpone approval of the future land use plan "until more detailed planning" can be completed. (this is the current tactic floating around the 'neighbor character preservation' set)  (mr artuso's home was assessed at $1.29mil in 2021)

name: molly conger
tweet: a handful of people who can't stay on the call long enough to speak at the public hearing are letting council know they support removing the statues. i think it's obvious at this point council will remove them, the issue is where they will go.

name: molly conger
tweet: jess walters says they wants to speak specifically on the importance of transforming, rather than simply transporting the statues. just relocating the harm doesn't reduce it.

name: molly conger
tweet: republican candidate for state delegate philip andrew hamilton says we should "add to" our history instead of "destroying" it, advocating for contextualization of the confederate monuments.

name: molly conger
tweet: "cities all over the country have taken down their confederate monuments," but how many have taken the extra step to transform them into something beautiful?  this country doesn't need statues of generals on horses,"it needs monuments forged from their remains," ramona says

name: molly conger
tweet: local artist ramona martinez says in the early 20th century, charlottesville was notable for having 4 commissioned statues, uncommon in a small southern town. now, 100 years later... we're still famous for those statues, for a very different reason.

name: molly conger
tweet: hamilton says we should put in a statue of grant next to lee and a monument of the 68 UVA students who fought for the union in the park next to the jackson statue

name: molly conger
tweet: (these parks are so small, putting in a second statue would be visually bizarre, on top of this being a bad idea generally from a bad faith troll)

name: molly conger
tweet: "which side of history do you want to be on? which kind of ancestor do you all wish to be?" zyahna bryant asks the charlottesville city council

name: molly conger
tweet: in 2017, we had a mayor who was too worried about being sued to take a stand. and "we continue to have people elected to office who prioritize property," who do not prioritize black lives, zy says.

name: molly conger
tweet: zyahna bryant, the young black activist behind the original petition to remove the confederate statues years ago, is up now. "what has changed since 2017?" she asks. what has changed since those statues brought nazis to our streets.

name: molly conger
tweet: scott wawner says he wants to keep history in front of us, not renaming things named after slave owners. "it's a bad thing" to "sanitize history," he says. wawner is trying to revive the plan to move the statues to mcintire park.

name: molly conger
tweet: "history exists in other places, in other forms," williamson says. melting down these statues doesn't destroy history, it just takes take of a statue. you don't learn history by going to a park and looking at a statue.

name: molly conger
tweet: bruce williamson says council was right & on the right side of history when they first voted to remove the statues. the recontextualization suggestions from the blue ribbon commission were made at a different moment in our history.

name: molly conger
tweet: williamson urges council to take the kind of action they will look back on years from now and think, "damn, i made a really good decision," the kind of action they can be proud of (melting down the statues)

name: molly conger
tweet: robert fudge, an albemarle county resident & member of the local quaker meeting house, says the nazis who came here in 2017 rallied around those statues for a reason - they are symbols of white supremacy.  "historic monuments should not perpetuate myths," he says.

name: molly conger
tweet: "they continue to serve the purpose for which they were built," fudge says. "i believe what we choose to put on a pedestal in a public place matters," and these statues no longer represent charlottesville's values.

name: molly conger
tweet: bayless says we have to consider lee & jackson as "products of their time" and "most southerners did not own slaves." he is concerned there aren't more older, white southern voices in this conversation, lol

name: molly conger
tweet: bruce bayless says that he is an "older, white southerner." he says lee & jackson did some good things in their lives, citing lee's service in the mexican war & says jackson "taught black children"

name: molly conger
tweet: daniel fairley, the city's youth opportunity coordinator, says this is an opportunity council cannot pass up - they can be the ones who remove these statues. he says the nazis came here to make the city second guess the decision to remove those statues.

name: molly conger
tweet: "we can tell our history without glorifying it," fairley says. we can tell the story of the confederacy, of the civil war, without raising confederate generals up onto pedestals.

name: molly conger
tweet: "it's literally still happening. we have not gotten help," romero says of the aftermath of the august 12, 2017 white supremacist violence. "this is one basic thing you can get done," she says to council on taking down the statues.

name: molly conger
tweet: natalie romero was one of the people severely injured in the vehicle attack on august 12, 2017. she reminds council that she & other victims still have unpaid medical bills.

name: molly conger
tweet: "i urge you all to remember why they were put up," romero tells council. the meaning & intent behind those statues matter and that has real world ramifications today. "y'all got this. this is a no-brainer."

name: molly conger
tweet: walt heineke called in about the recent spate of shootings in charlottesville. he says it's time to start having serious conversations about income inequality & poverty & how that creates conditions that lead to violence.

name: molly conger
tweet: anyway, time for a quick recess, then we'll get to the public hearing on the UTILITY RATES, and *then* we will get to the public hearing on the statues. i believe public comment during a public hearing is unlimited? or at least it can be - it isn't capped at 16 like this portion.

name: molly conger
tweet: not to be a meeting rules guy, but if everyone who spoke during general public comment because they didn't have time to stay for the public hearing on the statues had waited until the public hearing on the statues, we would already be on the public hearing

name: molly conger
tweet: oh, recess music, this is new! (dog barks added here at home)  https://t.co/TQe2OGHnu1

name: molly conger
tweet: due to COVID, utility rates were not changed last year, so they have not been adjusted in two years, says chris cullinan, the city's director of finance.

name: molly conger
tweet: we are BACK & it's time to talk about utility rates. charlottesville water & gas utilities operate as enterprise funds - they self fund & are operated on a break-even basis, they are not meant to generate profit for themselves/the city.

name: molly conger
tweet: i'm making chicken nuggets & enjoying a nice powerpoint 😎  https://t.co/JxQly9EZQH

name: molly conger
tweet: the utility rate report starts on p 108 of the agenda packet if you're interested!    https://t.co/rTxhEHNuvL  https://t.co/fyqmTFrYIM

name: molly conger
tweet: 94% of customers (pretty much all residential customers) will just see that $1/mo increase for wastewater  https://t.co/rCtaJKAAad

name: molly conger
tweet: the average customer, someone who gets all 4 of these utilities from the city & uses an average amount of water & gas, will see about a $3 monthly increase  https://t.co/O0Qp26hECg

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says the utility rate change will go on the consent agenda at the next meeting. they want to leave plenty of space for the next public hearing, which is on the removal of the confederate monuments.

name: molly conger
tweet: it may shock you to find out that no one has raised their hand to speak during the public hearing on a small change to the utility rates. mayor walker says councilors met with staff in 2 to 1s ahead of the meeting, so they have had their questions answered already.

name: molly conger
tweet: ok it turns out they forgot to activate the raise hand icon but now that it IS active, there is someone with a public comment on the utility rates.

name: molly conger
tweet: brad slocum says he is glad to hear the city's gas debt is paid off - that's a great step toward seeing what it would look like to divest from gas. the city should explore ways to incentivize people to divest from gas infrastructure in their homes.

name: molly conger
tweet: "not all of us are able to pay our bills right now; the pandemic put a lot of us in a really big hole," says natalie romero about the proposed utility rate increases. (this is a valid concern generally but the increase most of us will see is about $34 annually)

name: molly conger
tweet: vice mayor sena magill reminds people to open their utility bills even if they auto-pay or pay online - the city uses those bills to send out a lot of important information, including info about applying for utility bill assistance programs

name: molly conger
tweet: chip boyles says staff has recommended approval of the resolution that starts on p 120 of the packet   the packet contains many of the past resolutions on the issue, dating back to 2016.    https://t.co/rTxhEHNuvL  https://t.co/HWV43poM5i

name: molly conger
tweet: there are 19 people in the zoom audience who have activated the 'raise hand' icon. mayor walker says people who already spoke on the issue during general public comment should not be allowed to speak during this public hearing, but may speak again during closing public comment.

name: molly conger
tweet: the statues serve to attract armed, violent extremists to our parks, says kat maybury. they are a legitimate public safety threat. just last month, someone was cited for illegal possession of a firearm in one of the parks.

name: molly conger
tweet: maybury says she knows some members of council & knows they are good people, she doesn't think they will just push these statues off on some other community, to be some other community's problem. now is the time to do something transformative, she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: "when someone shows you who they are, believe them the first time," says gail hyder wiley, quoting maya angelou. these statues were erected with racist pomp & circumstance - with little girls singing dixie & waving confederate flags. now they bring armed militia types.

name: molly conger
tweet: the funds have already been allocated, gail says. it's past time to remove them. "charlottesville has the nation's attention, this is our chance to change the meaning of our hashtag to one of positive vision, to perhaps quite literally beat our swords into plowshares."

name: molly conger
tweet: andrew shelton thanks council for everything they've done to get us to this point. shelton says he, like an earlier speaker, is a 'white southern male,' but unlike that previous speaker, he recognizes the statues need to go.

name: molly conger
tweet: seth houston owns a small business located downtown, near the statues. "what we do next and how we do it" is an important part of the story of how charlottesville grapples with the legacy of racism. it's not just taking them down, but it's how to we transform the space.

name: molly conger
tweet: "removing these statues isn't destroying history, it's making space for a real accounting of our history by correcting a lie," miller says.

name: molly conger
tweet: daniel miller says he is a white, 9th generation virginian. he says the man who said older, white southern men are underrepresented is wrong & that that man's belief that all older white southern men agree that slavery should continue to be commemorated.

name: molly conger
tweet: kathryn laughon counts herself among the 'older white southerners' who support removing the statues. she adds her voice to those who encourage council to "be courageous and visionary," to transform rather than export the statues so they can no longer serve as a racist rally point

name: molly conger
tweet: jane smith says the caller who said older white southerners aren't being represented here prompted her to call in. she is a 71 year old from the mississippi delta who lives here now. smith says charlottesville will be better off without the statues & no community needs them.

name: molly conger
tweet: joe szakos thanks our state delegate @SallyLHudson for her work ensuring all localities in virginia have the ability to choose to remove these monuments.

name: molly conger
tweet: joe szakos says this is a rare opportunity in their lives to take such a monumental step to disrupt white supremacy. "we still have a lot of work to do, but removing these monuments from public spaces will send a clear signal," he says.

name: molly conger
tweet: gregory weaver says growing up in virginia, we're indoctrinated with the lost cause myth in school.  these are statues of white supremacists, installed by white supremacists, paid for by a white supremacist, & serve as tools of white supremacy.

name: molly conger
tweet: "trying to atone for centuries of evil starts here - we must destroy them," weaver says of charlottesville's confederate statues.

name: molly conger
tweet: leslie middleton urges council to get the removal of the statues done before the 4 year anniversary of august 12, 2017.

name: molly conger
tweet: former charlottesville city councilor krisitin szakos says she has been advocating for the removal of these monuments since 2012, but she was "merely joining a long line of people, mostly our african american neighbors" in recognizing the harm the statues cause.

name: molly conger
tweet: szakos says that when we was on council in 2017, they voted to set aside half a million dollars for removing the statues. that money remains allocated for this purpose.

name: molly conger
tweet: dukes says albemarle county deserves credit for being the 1st locality in VA to remove their confederate statue under the new law, but they made a mistake in allowing it to be relocated. we should not make the same mistake - we should melt them down.

name: molly conger
tweet: linda dukes says the statues are morally untenable & continue to serve as lightning rods for violence in our community.

name: molly conger
tweet: kori price, a local artist & proud black woman, says the statues should be removed immediately. in addition to being harmful, "they are eyesores." the lee statue is, objectively speaking, poorly made & badly proportioned! (it's ugly and ridiculous looking!!!!)

name: molly conger
tweet: price asks council to reenvision the parks as spaces of unity & inclusion.  cali gaston says the statues must come down & be destroyed.

name: molly conger
tweet: brad slocum says that as a survivor of violence at unite the right, he still gets a fight or flight response near the park where the lee statue stands. since then, he has monitored the far right online & can attest that the statues remain of interest to the far right.

name: molly conger
tweet: brad, too, advocates for fully destroying the confederate monuments. they don't belong in someone else's town square, they don't belong in a museum. they should be melted down.

name: molly conger
tweet: dukes served on the blue ribbon commission that, years ago, recommended recontextualization or relocation. "we were wrong," he says. they need to be removed & never again displayed publicly.

name: molly conger
tweet: frank dukes also identifies himself as an old white southern man, whose ancestors came to virginia in the 17th century. the statues teach a false history, he says.

name: molly conger
tweet: amanda moxham, a founding member of the hate free schools coalition, reminds council that charlottesville city schools banned confederate imagery in schools in 2018. it's time to remove & transform the statues that dominate our public squares.

name: molly conger
tweet: "the world is watching," moxham says, "but more importantly - our children are watching."

name: molly conger
tweet: rader says the statues should be taken down immediately, pending the decision about their ultimate fate. it can't wait.   "when we remove them, the space of their absence will hum with meaning," she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: miranda elliott rader says, as an artist, she believes in the power of transformative art. we can't just export them to another community where another high school student will have to petition to remove them. they can be transformed into something healing.

name: molly conger
tweet: ben doherty also urges council to remove the statues BEFORE the anniversary of august 12. ben, too, says the statues cannot be allowed to continue to serve as magnets for white supremacists by simply relocating them to another community.

name: molly conger
tweet: "this council has a moral obligation to change the narrative that was established in the 1920s," carpenter says. "don't give them to another community, to visit that trauma on them." they should be melted into commemorative coins, she suggests.

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy carpenter says sunday was a beautiful day. she bought lunch downtown and wanted to enjoy the weather under a beautiful shade tree in a park downtown. while she was enjoying her lunch, she encountered one of our "park watchers," the neo-confederates the statues attract.

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy was the 20th speaker during this public hearing. brian wheeler says there are currently 11 more hands raised to speak & gives instructions on joining the zoom webinar at  https://t.co/noxT8ntyCB if you want to jump in line.

name: molly conger
tweet: edward smith says robert e lee was a great virginian who freed his slaves, etc etc lost cause brainwashing "lee and jackson were not fighting to preserve slavery but for states rights which the north was denying them" lmao is he reading from my 3rd grade history textbook?

name: molly conger
tweet: THEY WERE FIGHTING TO PRESERVE THEIR HOMELAND FROM NORTHERN INVADERS  sir please

name: molly conger
tweet: "oh, for the love of god," don gathers sighs as they unmute his mic so he can give his comment.   "there is no gray area here, there is no middle ground," gathers says. history will judge us on how we proceed here. "it's past time for those things to come down."

name: molly conger
tweet: "if my trash ends up in a neighbor's yard, it's still trash," gathers says. "wherever they land, those people will show up," he says, calling the confederate statues a bat signal for white supremacists.

name: molly conger
tweet: "the answer just seems so obvious," says lena seville. "transformation is just the only responsible choice." she, too, is advocating for melting the damn things down.

name: molly conger
tweet: nic mccarthy rivera also urges council to get the statues out of the parks before the anniversary this summer but says covering them ahead of their removal may actually be MORE unsafe & serve as an invitation for the monument defenders. (the tarps were a big issue in 2017)

name: molly conger
tweet: nic says the metal should be melted & the stone reworked by black artists. they need to be transformed into something antithetical to what they now represent. it may take time to find the right artist & the statues should be hidden away until that can be done.

name: molly conger
tweet: dr larycia hawkins says she is offended that we need the testimony of white women, the liberal resistance. "can we hear the blood of my ancestors crying from the ground?"  "i am sally hemings' ghost here to haunt city hall," she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: virginia's shame does not belong in museums, hawkins says. they need to be destroyed. that's what justice looks like. destroying the statues does not erase history - the statues themselves represent an erasure.

name: molly conger
tweet: "it's farcical that after everything this community's gone through" we have to go through this process of public hearings before we can remove the statues, says brandon collins, but he's grateful we're moving toward removal now.

name: molly conger
tweet: 86 attendees is significantly more than usual (and people watch on facebook, local access tv, and the city's streaming page, too)  https://t.co/oKjkHr53AH

name: molly conger
tweet: @dourpickle this was a very unpopular statement with many subsequent callers lmao

name: molly conger
tweet: zakk brown, a richmond based fascist nerd who recently caught a charge for illegally carrying a gun in one of our downtown parks, says "you're crying about bronze" and says A12 was four years ago & it's racist against white people to be upset about it.

name: molly conger
tweet: this guy wants you to stop discriminating against white people  https://t.co/dBOWjWErGA

name: molly conger
tweet: ibby han says we can't export the statues to another community - they need to be melted down.

name: molly conger
tweet: lashundra bryson supports immediately removing them. "i don't think they can be repurposed." "they should be taken away in the night, with no announcement or fanfare." she says it would be fitting for them to disappear into the night, like so many black people stolen by slavers.

name: molly conger
tweet: elizabeth shillue says she's learned some of the real history these statues represent & it's worth noting that stonewall jackson never so much as visited this area. he isn't part of our local history in any capacity!

name: molly conger
tweet: yolonda adams thanks council for making the public hearing remotely accessible for people like her - moms who can't be at a meeting at 10pm on a weeknight. (the city is exploring keeping a hybrid model even after the state of emergency ends, which would be amazing)

name: molly conger
tweet: adams recalls don gathers' comment about trash - taking trash and putting it in your neighbor's yard isn't cleaning up. relocating the statues doesn't mitigate the harm they cause. they're trash anywhere you put them.

name: molly conger
tweet: adams says she knows taking the statues down doesn't resolve centuries of harm, but "it could be a beacon of hope for how we could continue to make sure we are amplifying the voices of disadvantaged communities."

name: molly conger
tweet: "i've only been here 48 years," ms gloria says, but people who've been here a long time tell her that black children were not allowed to play in that park at one time (vice mayor magill confirms it was once a whites-only park by law)

name: molly conger
tweet: adams was the 32nd speaker during this hearing, brian wheeler says. ms gloria beard says she never took her kids to those parks in all her decades of living here. "i never felt like we were welcome there," she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: ang conn says "giving these statues to another community shouldn't even be an option." she asks council how they could sleep at night knowing the danger they'd be putting black & brown people in by putting those statues in some other town square.

name: molly conger
tweet: katrena cooper says "it's trash and it should be put nowhere," of the statues.

name: molly conger
tweet: kimberly lowe says burying our horrors does not change them or teach about them. she also worries about spending the money on removing the statues and is now rattling off stats about "modern day slavery," human trafficking.

name: molly conger
tweet: lowe says we need to keep the statues up to remind everyone about slavery (damn kim, you should find out what's in the big building right next to the racist statue - it's called a library and you can learn about slavery in there!)

name: molly conger
tweet: paula belton says she is not a virginia resident but she is "a big history lover." she says the US is not the only country that's had a civil war and that china uses statues about war to teach about history (can you elaborate on china's statue-based war curriculum?)

name: molly conger
tweet: deteasa gathers says her grandmother was alive when that statue went up. she remembers as a child being told by her grandmother about those parks, "oh we don't go there."

name: molly conger
tweet: deteasa gathers says she is a native virginian, but she can't give you her genealogy like some of the other callers have because as a black virginian, much of her family history has been erased.

name: molly conger
tweet: "i keep hearing about heritage, heritage, heritage," says katrina turner. "that's one thing i don't have." white virginians have been calling in detailing their family history... black virginians can't do that. their histories have been erased.

name: molly conger
tweet: sarah kelley is 80 years old. she recalls passing lee park as a child and being told "to get to steppin'" because she was on the wrong side of charlottesville. as a little girl, she didn't even know who it was, she just liked horses and wanted to see the horse statue.

name: molly conger
tweet: wendy hayslett, a confederate nuisance, is trying to call in but having technical difficulties.

name: molly conger
tweet: "even though the name has changed, the hurt hasn't changed," she says of lee park (now called market street park), which used to be a whites-only space. the statues should come down, kelley says.

name: molly conger
tweet: "you can't contextualize hate," says walt heinecke. we have to remove them from public view. "we should do this because black lives matter." and we should do the same to the sacagawea statue because indigenous lives matter. "we're at a breaking point in history," walt says.

name: molly conger
tweet: this is wendy hayslett, by the way   https://t.co/f3NYzrnEaR

name: molly conger
tweet: wendy hayslett says she wants to protect her children's birthright & advocate for the delivery of the statues to the shenandoah valley battlefield where they can be "protected and preserved for our children"

name: molly conger
tweet: 40+ speakers into this public hearing & no one is interested in this shrill defense of the confederacy from a racist menace who doesn't live here  https://t.co/cVgodbrl3P

name: molly conger
tweet: "please, please do not relocate them to any battlefield or any other community," says andrea massey, who also says they should be melted down. andrea was the 55th speaker!! and the public hearing is now closed. i'm glad hayslett didn't get the last word.

name: molly conger
tweet: "the community has certainly spoken," says councilor heather hill. she appreciates the engagement & says the message is clear.

name: molly conger
tweet: our councilors are also members of our community. vice mayor sena magill nearly lost her husband to an injury from a torch wielding nazi. michael payne was present at the car attack. they aren't just hearing the community's pain - they feel it.

name: molly conger
tweet: councilor lloyd snook says you can agree or disagree that the blue ribbon commission's recommendations to move/contextualize the statues were wrong at the time, but we can all acknowledge that things changed after august 12.

name: molly conger
tweet: snook says it isn't "crystal clear" to him yet what should happen with the statues, but they can't stay where they are.

name: molly conger
tweet: to the people saying the statues have to come down now, snook says there is "statutory procedure" that has to be observed. cutting corners or acting hastily could result in further litigation.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker recalls deteasa gathers' comments about seeing the statues through her own ten year old eyes, being told by her grandmother that the park wasn't for her, how she now has a 10 year old granddaughter. she told council to remove those statues for the next ten year old.

name: molly conger
tweet: "the work isn't complete at that moment," mayor walker says of removing the statues. it isn't everything, it isn't enough, "but removing the obstacles that are in the way" matters.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says she hopes all the people advocating for removal of the statues are having the same conversations, with the same intensity, with their neighbors about the land use map. the same power structures that put the statues up were responsible for redlining.

name: molly conger
tweet: "once these statues are destroyed, there is so much work left to do in our community," says mayor walker. "we shouldn't need white women, or white men, or the elite" to come be in agreement with black people "when we say enough is enough."

name: molly conger
tweet: "there was a ten year old girl at one time, that was deteasa," recalling mrs gathers comment again, and there will continue to be ten year olds, with or without the statues standing, who have to contend with the power & influence of whiteness, mayor walker says.

name: molly conger
tweet: it is 10:46pm on june 7, 2021 and charlottesville city councilor michael payne has made the motion to remove the statues of lee & jackson from our downtown parks.

name: molly conger
tweet: the motion carries unanimously.    https://t.co/2Q1z0MGSj9

name: molly conger
tweet: that concludes the agenda. now there is an open public comment period. people who have spoken previously are allowed to speak again & can speak on any topic.

name: molly conger
tweet: philip andrew hamilton, the troll candidate for state delegate, is back up. he proposes erecting monuments to union soldiers alongside the confederate monuments. he agrees with the caller who said china uses monuments to their civil war to teach history (???????)

name: molly conger
tweet: hamilton says we are moving closer to marxism by embracing cancel culture (removing confederate monuments)

name: molly conger
tweet: "we need to increase the diversity of historical monuments and increase representation of native americans, asians, blacks, and other minorities," hamilton says.

name: molly conger
tweet: "this is not work that y'all started," zy says. "this is not work that you get to take credit for," but they have a responsibility to carry it over the finish line. this has been a community effort over many years.

name: molly conger
tweet: zy bryant is back up. "it's interesting that everyone has to much history, everyone wants to be like other countries," but they're not ready to adopt things like universal healthcare, like other countries have done.

name: molly conger
tweet: zy also said she recently had an incident with councilor heather hill where she tried to speak to heather & heather just walked away from her. heather says she recalls the incident differently (but i can see heather being too cowardly to talk to zy, tbh)

name: molly conger
tweet: (telling us that "history lovers" will flock to the city before the removal is not a selling point, paula! we do not want you fucking confederate freaks wandering around downtown!)

name: molly conger
tweet: paula belton, the out of state "history lover" who said china uses statues to teach history is back.  she opposes covering the statues before removal because not all history lovers have had a chance to see them yet.

name: molly conger
tweet: the city is required to solicit & receive these offers, but there's nothing in the law that says they have to accept any of the offers.

name: molly conger
tweet: brian wheeler says the city will post information on the website by tomorrow so the public can see how to respond to the action taken tonight - the city will take proposals from orgs that want to take possession of the statue

name: molly conger
tweet: ang conn says particularly in light of the previous comment, she urges council to take swift action. now that this is in motion, the longer they're up, the more white supremacists will make a pilgrimage here to see them one last time.

name: molly conger
tweet: nya bryant, zy's sister, says heather hill has a history of calling black people liars. she says she witnessed the incident zy spoke of where heather walked away from her when she tried to have a conversation. "i think you need to humble yourself."

name: molly conger
tweet: katrina turner says maybe not everyone who wants to look at the statues is dangerous, but certainly enough of them are. people who would make a trip here this summer to see the statues one last time could be a danger to the community.

name: molly conger
tweet: ms katrina says she just "can't understand it," "what are these people so proud of that they want to keep these statues up?" are they proud of slavery?  she hopes & prays council will cover the statues immediately & remove them swiftly.

name: molly conger
tweet: cottrell says the civil war happened because two groups of people stopped communicating with each other, not because there was a good side and a bad side. he says robert e lee was a good and complex man. i'm CHOKING here.

name: molly conger
tweet: "i have nothing to do with what's going on in your community," says john-henry cottrell, calling in from california about why he won't weigh in on the coverings. but he will give us a bad opinion about the civil war.

name: molly conger
tweet: "our country right now is 100% broken and split. it is going in the same direction as the 1840s and 1850s when people stopped talking to each other," we just need to do more LISTENING, he says. he says the statues represent a time when people "stopped talking to each other"

name: molly conger
tweet: please, i'm dying

name: molly conger
tweet: "you talk about history, we're not teaching history - we're teaching 'em freaking lies," nancy says about the perpetuation of the lost cause narrative. our own historical society won't disclose the provenance of the klan robes on display, she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy carpenter says when she was a child, many decades ago, her textbook printed lies about the civil war, curriculum influenced by the united daughters of the confederacy. "it wasn't until i was a grown woman that i understood what was actually going on in the united states."

name: molly conger
tweet: dr larycia hawkins is back on. she takes issue with the way people keep bringing up that there were black confederate soldiers, too - saying that enslaved people didn't have a choice about their involvement in the war.

name: molly conger
tweet: "this isn't about talks breaking down between reasonable people," dr hawkins says. "people who owned people to maintain power" fought to keep power, fought to keep slavery. "this isn't about cancel culture," "it's about correcting the lies."

name: molly conger
tweet: "i'm not just some amateur historian," dr hawkins says, "i'm a black professor." this is about righting wrongs.

name: molly conger
tweet: "it's racism. it's killing bodies. it's killing souls. it's killing our country. that's what's killing our country," not people not communicating with each other, hawkins says. "this is the end. black and brown people, BIPOC people, we're done. we're finished," she says.

name: molly conger
tweet: ok meeting adjourned.

name: molly conger
tweet: the city will post information on the website sometime tonight or tomorrow about how to submit a proposal for taking possession of the statue. they'll accept proposals for 30 days but are not obligated to accept any proposal. the ultimate decision rests with council.

name: molly conger
tweet: the city of charlottesville has posted the press release about the request for statements of interest on the confederate statues. (the actual RFI will go up tomorrow) they'll accept statements through july 8, 2021.    https://t.co/gSbvRP7fU5  https://t.co/hsA4EOlH8R

name: molly conger
tweet: i want to at least put out there that there's no value in submitting joke statements of interest. staff are gonna have to wade through some real messed up stuff from confederate weirdos. city staff aren't the bad guys here, don't mess with them.
